title: Are there any good YA novels written in the 3rd person? - Quora

response.answer_text: Check out Frances Hardinge’s books - all are written in the third person. Fly by Night and its follow up Fly Trap Verdigris Deep (Well Witched) Gullstruck Island (The Lost Conspiracy) A Face Like Glass Cuckoo Song The Lie Tree It’s a little unfortunate that she’s classified as Young Adult as I think her appeal is much wider. She a seriously good writer with a wildly inventive imagination but everything hangs together and nothing seems contrived. The “Fly” books feature a homicidal goose!

The Selection by Kiera Cass (there are 5 novels in this series) it’s a dystopian/romance about a competition to find the next princess who will marry Maxon, the prince, and be the future queen.The Scorpio Races by Maggie Stiefvater once a year, water horses emerge from the ocean, and they are captured for a dangerous race to see who can hold on the longest. Four time champion Sean Kendrick will be riding again, and a new rider, Kate “Puck” Connolly will be a first-time rider.
